articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives High-ranking Military Delegation of CPLA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives High-ranking Military Delegation of CPLA
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Thursday received the high-ranking military delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the General Political Department of the CPLA, on a visit to the DPRK.
					
					 Present there were General Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Jong Gak, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and first vice department director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, and KPA Generals Kim Won Hong and Pak Jae Gyong.
					
					 Present there from the Chinese side were Li Jinai, Lieut. Gen. Ding Jiye, deputy director of the CPLA General Logistics Department, Lieut. Gen. Chen Xiaogong, deputy commander of the Air Force, Lieut. Gen. Wang Dengping, political commissar of the North Sea Fleet of the Navy,  Lieut. Gen. Zhao Zongqi, chief of the Staff of the Jinan Military Area,  Major General Kan Likui, vice-director of the Operation Department of the General Staff of the CPLA, Major General Ci Guowei, deputy director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Ministry of National Defense, Major General Li Fengshan, deputy secretary-general of the General Office of the General Political Department of the CPLA, Chinese Ambassador Liu Hongcai and Military, Naval and Air Attache Sun Yanfeng of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Li Jinai conveyed Kim Jong Il the warm greetings of the members of the collective leadership of the Communist Party of China including Hu Jintao, general secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and president of the People's Republic of China.
					
					 Li Jinai expressed most heartfelt thanks to Kim Jong Il for receiving the high-ranking military delegation of the CPLA by sparing his precious time though he was very busy leading the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 Li Jinai gave his impressions of the DPRK, saying he was particularly and deeply moved to see for himself the signal successes made by the fraternal people and army of the DPRK in various fields under the leadership of the WPK headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The traditional Sino-DPRK friendship forged and cultivated by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries have entered a new stage of development under the deep care of Hu Jintao and Kim Jong Il, he said.
					
					 In recent years there was a brisk exchange of high-ranking delegations between the two countries and important agreements were reached on developing the friendly and cooperative relations and bilateral exchange and cooperation in various fields including politics, economy and military affairs have registered steady and abundant achievements, he noted.
					
					 It is the steadfast policy of the party, government and army of China to put into practice the common understandings reached between the leaders of the two countries and boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the peoples of the two countries, between the armies, in particular, he added.
					
					 Kim Jong Il warmly welcomed the visit of the high-ranking military delegation of the CPLA to the DPRK and asked Li Jinai to pass his warm regards to the members of the collective leadership of the CPC including Hu Jintao and the fraternal army and people of China.
					
					 The armies of the two countries have played a positive role in developing the DPRK-China friendly relations in the past, he expressed the belief that there would be no change in the sense of revolutionary obligation and class principle between the armies and peoples of the two countries no matter how the situation may change in the future.
					
					 Li Jinai presented Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un with the gifts prepared by him with his best wishes.
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed deep thanks for this.
					
					 He hosted a dinner in honor of the guests.
					
					 The dinner proceeded in an amicable atmosphere overflowing with friendship.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Sultan of Oman
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Sultan of Oman 

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Qaboos Bin Said, sultan of Oman, on its national day.
					
					 Kim, in the message, wished the sultan happiness in good health and the friendly Oman people progress and prosperity, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between two countries would steadily develop on good terms.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Visits Pyongyang Underground Shop
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Visits Pyongyang Underground Shop
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim visited the Autumn Commodity Fair at the Pyongyang Underground Shop on Wednesday.
					
					 Looking round counters of the fair he acquainted himself in detail with varieties and quality of commodities and their price fixing and packing.
					
					 It is important to produce more consumer goods for the people to get substantial benefits since modern light industrial production bases were built across the country under the far-reaching plan of the Party to bring about decisive turn in the improvement of the people's standard of living, the premier stressed.

articles.title: Kim Ki Nam Meets IIJI Director-General
articles.content:
Kim Ki Nam Meets IIJI Director-General
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Thursday met and had a talk with Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from IIJI
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from IIJI

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI).
					
					 The gift was handed over to Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Thursday by Vishwanath, director-general of the IIJI and secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Chinese Military Delegation Visits Int'l Friendship Exhibition House
articles.content:
Chinese Military Delegation Visits Int'l Friendship Exhibition House
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The high-ranking military delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the General Political Department of the CPLA, visited the International Friendship Exhibition House on Thursday.
					
					 The visitors made bows in boundless reverence to the wax replica of President Kim Il Sung who made undying contributions to the development of friendship among countries and the human cause of independence. 
					
					They looked round with deep emotion the gifts presented to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il by party, state and government leaders and prominent personages of many countries.
					
					 At the end of the visit, the head of the delegation said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung is a great man with the noblest virtues.
					
					 The world people are deeply revering him.
					
					 This is evidenced by a lot of valuable gifts exhibited at the House.
					
					 The great President Kim Il Sung will be with us.
					
					 Prier to the visit, the delegation toured Kim Il Sung Political University, Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory.

articles.title: ASEAN Secretary-General Hopes for DPRK's Active Role in ASEAN
articles.content:
ASEAN Secretary-General Hopes for DPRK's Active Role in ASEAN
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- I hope that the DPRK would play an active role in ASEAN, including the regional forum, in the future, too, and thus contribute to the development of relations with ASEAN and the process of building ASEAN Community.
					
					 Surin Pitsuwan, secretary-general of ASEAN, said this on Nov. 11 when receiving credentials from Ri Jong Ryul, DPRK ambassador to this body.
					
					 The secretary-general said:
					
					 I am pleased with the fact that everything is going well in the DPRK under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, and hope for greater successes and progress in your country.
					
					 The relations between ASEAN and the DPRK have developed on good terms after the latter joined the ASEAN Regional Forum.

articles.title: Several Delegations of DPRK Leave
articles.content:
Visits

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Several delegations of the DPRK left here on Thursday to visit different countries.
					
					 They included a Korean youth friendly delegation led by Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, to visit China, a delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society led by Paek Yong Ho, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, to attend the 18th General Meeting of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and the 31st International Red Cross Meeting in Geneva of Switzerland and a delegation of the State Maritime Supervisory Bureau led by Vice-Director Jon Ki Chol to attend the 27th Assembly of the International Maritime Organization in Britain.
					
					 Meanwhile the delegation of publishers by Han Chol Ho, vice-director of the Publication Guidance Bureau, came back home after visiting China.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from President of WFDY
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from President of WFDY 

					Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Tiago Alexandre Ferraz Vieira, president of the World Federation of Democratic Youth (WFDY).
					
					 The president on Nov. 12 handed the gift over to Kil Chol Hyok, secretary of the C.C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League who attended the 18th Congress of the WFDY as head of the youth league delegation.

articles.title: Romanian Embassy Officials Visit Korean Art Gallery
articles.content:
Romanian Embassy Officials Visit Korean Art Gallery

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Mititelu Neculae Cristian and staff members of the Romanian embassy here visited the Korean Art Gallery Thursday on the first anniversary of the DPRK-Romania inter-governmental agreement on cooperation in culture, education, science and sports.
					
					 They looked round the exhibited art works while being briefed on them.
					
					 On the same day they enjoyed an acrobatic performance at the Pyongyang Circus Theatre.

articles.title: DPRK Senior Officials Tour Major Industrial Establishments
articles.content:
Senior Party and State Officials Tour Major Industrial Establishments
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials and officials of the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions visited the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex and the February 8 Vinalon Complex on Thursday.
					
					Premier Choe Yong Rim, Jon Pyong Ho, director of the Political Bureau of the Cabinet, Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and other officials first went to the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex which declared its operation after successfully building the Juche-based fertilizer production processes. They toured with deep emotion various production processes of the complex including carbonic acid gas purification process, oxygen separator process and fertilizer-shipping site.
					
					 Then they visited the February 8 Vinalon Complex. At its horizontal spinning and fiber production process which was modernized in a short period, they were moved to see quality Juche-based vinalon fiber of socialist Korean style churning out.
					
					 The visitors keenly felt again the creative stamina and militant spirit of the workers and builders who perfected fertilizer and vinalon production processes in the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and fortitude and with matchless grit and pluck and the iron faith that they can do what Korea is determined.

articles.title: First-phase Gasification Process Goes Operational at Hungnam Fertilizer Complex
articles.content:
First-phase Gasification Process Goes Operational at Hungnam Fertilizer Complex

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The first-phase gasification process of the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex in South Hamgyong Province has been completed to start fertilizer production.
					
					 Workers, builders and supporters of the complex removed millions of cubic meters of old beddings in layers which had been cemented for scores of years. Then they swiftly finished the vast ground concrete tamping and simultaneously launched structural project and manufacture and assembling of equipment units.
					
					 They also perfectly made ultra-modern equipment units when they could not arrive and smoothly installed them and thus successfully finished very difficult and vast first-phase project in two and a half years which would have taken 10 odd years at an ordinary pace.
					
					 Its commissioning ceremony took place on Thursday.
					
					 Attending it were Choe Yong Rim, premier of the Cabinet, Jon Pyong Ho, director of its Political Bureau, Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Mu Yong, vice-premier, Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, leading officials of ministries and national institutions, officials of the province and relevant unites and employees, builders and helpers of the complex.
					
					Kwak Pom Gi in his address said that the completion of the first-phase gasification project is a precious fruition of the patriotic devotion made by General Secretary Kim Jong Il translating into brilliant reality the behests of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The advantage of the independent national economy and the indomitable mental power of the Korean workers unboundedly loyal to the Party and the leader have been fully displayed in the course of building Juche-based fertilizer production processes, he said.
					
					 He urged all officials and employees to keep the new production process in full capacity and work fresh miracles and merits once again in the general offensive for pushing ahead with the construction of the second-phase gasification process.
					
					 Speakers expressed the resolve to fan up the torch of South Hamgyong Province and thus greatly contribute to the building of a rich and powerful country.

articles.title: Horizontal Spinning Fiber Production Process Completed
articles.content:
Horizontal Spinning Fiber Production Process Completed

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The horizontal spinning fiber process has been updated at the February 8 Vinalon Complex in South Hamgyong Province.
					
					 Horizontal spinning fiber production process waw wonderfully rebuilt to ensure mass-production of quality vinalon.
					
					 The workers and builders of the complex finished the project for process of vinalon production by horizontal spinning in a little more than one year, which would have taken several years at an ordinary pace.
					
					 Its commissioning ceremony took place on the spot Thursday.
					
					 Present there were Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Jon Pyong Ho, director of the Cabinet Political Bureau, Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Mu Yong, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, officials of ministries, national institutions, the province and relevant units and employees, builders and helpers of the complex.
					
					 Kwak Pom Gi made an inaugural address which was followed by speeches.
					
					 The speakers said that the completion of modern horizontal spinning production process able to turn out quality vinalon fibre helped translate into a brilliant reality the lifelong desire of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They noted that thanks to the energetic leadership of Kim Jong Il who worked heart and soul for the development of the vinalon industry, the country could enjoy the auspicious event of vinalon fall.
					
					 They expressed the resolve to work fresh miracles and feats in the production of chemical goods including vinalon and modernization of the complex drive with the spirit, disposition and creative power of South Hamgyong Province and thus dynamically push forward the advance for the industrial revolution in the new century.

articles.title: Upswing Effected in S. Hamgyong Province
articles.content:
Upswing Effected in S. Hamgyong Province

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- A fresh upswing has been effected in industrial establishments of South Hamgyong Province, the DPRK.
					
					 The upswing is very significant as it has been effected in the historic period when all the Korean people has turned out in the effort to open up a new heyday of prosperity to mark the centenary birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The province owes the upswing to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He gave field guidance to the province on several occasions to indicate ways for making a great progress in construction and production.
					
					 Inspired by his guidance, the Ryongsong Machine Complex made modern geothermal equipment and the February 8 Vinalon Complex built a horizontal spinning process of vinalon production in only a few months.
					
					 The Taehung Youth Hero Mine and Ryongyang Mine have sharply increased production and the Tanchon area has undergone a radical change.
					
					 The Hungnam Fertilizer Complex has completed the first-stage gasification process in two and a half years, making it possible to produce ammonia with brown coal. 
					
					 Such achievements have also been reported from other industrial establishments and major construction projects in the province. 
					
					 The tremendous achievements of South Hamgyong Province are greatly encouraging people in all other provinces of the country to bring about an epoch-making turn in the effort for the prosperity of the country and the improvement of the people's living standard.

articles.title: Korean Scenic Spots Draw Many Foreign Tourists
articles.content:
Korean Scenic Spots Draw Many Foreign Tourists 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Since the DPRK took measures to promote tourism, many foreign tourists have come to the country.  
					
					This year the DPRK issued a decree on establishing the Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					 A large number of foreign tourists have enjoyed sightseeing in the famous mountain from June.    
					
					 Among them were a Liaoning provincial party and government delegation of China, a Chinese tourist group by the Pyongyang-Xi'an international air service and commanding officers of a Chinese navy flotilla. 
					
					 A trial Rason-Mt. Kumgang international tourism through a sea route also took place.
					
					 Reporters from China, Russia, France, the United States and other countries were aboard the ship to cover the tourism.
					
					 The ship Mangyongbong carried foreign tourists from Rason City in the northeastern tip of Korea to Mt. Kumgang through the East Sea of Korea.
					
					 The tourism including both sea and land sightseeing attracted great interest of foreigners.
					
					 A trial Harbin-Mt. Kumgang tourist group came to the DPRK by a chartered flight. 
					
					 The group enjoyed amazing views of Kuryong Waterfall, Singye Temple, Lagoon Samil and Sea Kumgang. 
					
					 Another Chinese tourist group arrived in Mt. Chilbo by train through Namyang Railway Station in Onsong County, North Hamgyong Province to tour its scenic spots.
					
					 The first Shanghai tourist group, through the Pyongyang-Shanghai air service, visited Mangyongdae, the Tower of the Juche Idea, Arch of Triumph, Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, Pyongyang Metro and Friendship Tower. 
					
					 The first Chinese tourist group by the Pyongyang-Harbin air service visited the International Friendship Exhibition House, Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, Panmunjom and other places of the country. It also appreciated the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang."
					
					 The Illinois-based Asia-Pacific Tourist Agency plans to organize tours of Mt. Paektu, Mt. Kumgang and other places in Korea next year.

articles.title: Popular Synthetic Leather Goods
articles.content:
Popular Synthetic Leather Goods

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The Phyongsong Synthetic Leather Factory in South Phyongan Province, DPRK produces quality synthetic leather.
					
					 Its branch factory turns out a variety of daily necessities with synthetic leader like schoolbag, handbag for ladies and suitcase.
					
					 Footwear factories across the country manufacture various models of shoes with products of the Phyongsong Synthetic Leather Factory.
					
					 Especially, women's shoes are popular among consumers.
					
					 The Phyongsong Synthetic Leather Factory has a large production capacity and all its production processes ranging from the feeding of raw materials to forwarding are streamlined. 
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the factory in October and expressed great satisfaction with its production of quality goods.

articles.title: Minju Joson Hits at Moves of Japan, S. Korea for Triangular Military Alliance
articles.content:
Minju Joson Hits at Moves of Japan, S. Korea for Triangular Military Alliance 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The naval force of Japan's "Self-Defense Forces" and the south Korean navy staged joint military exercises under the name of rescue operation to cope with disasters at sea on the waters off northern area of Tsushima on Nov. 12 and 13. 
					
					 Minju Joson Thursday runs a bylined commentary in this regard. 
					
					 It says: 
					
					 Japan and south Korea intensify the military cooperation as the days go by. This is grave threat to the peace and security in Northeast Asia and unpardonable military provocation to the DPRK and its neighboring countries. 
					
					 Japan and south Korea called the recent exercises "maritime rescue operation drill". This is nothing but a deceptive drama to cover up their criminal intention and relax vigilance of neighboring countries.
					
					 Their intensified cooperation in military field is mainly intended to form the triangular military alliance of the U.S., Japan and south Korea pursuant to the U.S. scenario and, on this basis, maintain and strengthen the military supremacy in the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					 Under the pretext of protecting its allies' security from "military threat" by someone, the U.S. strengthens its relations of military cooperation with Japan and south Korea while trying to establish the relations of military cooperation between Japan and south Korea. In this way it seeks to form the triangular military alliance and, on the basis of it, secure its military control and domination over the Asia-Pacific region as a whole. 
					
					 The world is taking pains to prevent the tension of the Korean Peninsula from being escalated and relax it and create atmosphere for dialogue. However, the U.S. and its followers are getting frantic with the moves to form the triangular military alliance for aggression. This anachronistic deed is a grave challenge to the wishes of humankind for peace. 
					
					 Not only the U.S. but also its followers will have to pay dearly for their anti-DPRK confrontation moves.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Contradiction of Capitalism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Contradiction of Capitalism 

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and other western countries are now suffering from such economic crises as financial and debt crisis. This is an inevitable result of the phenomenon prevalent in capitalist society where the rich get ever richer and the poor get ever poorer.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 The widening gap between the rich and the poor is extremely aggravating the class contradiction in capitalist society, the article says, and goes on: 
					
					 The phenomenon in which the rich get ever richer and the poor get ever poorer is peculiar to exploitative society. It has become an incurable disease in capitalist society which is based on extreme individualism and liberalism and where money is almighty. 
					
					 The demos taking place almost every day in capitalist countries prove absurdity of "class cooperation" and "welfare policy" much touted by monopolists and ruling quarters. They also show that such malignant evils of capitalist society as concentration of wealth into a handful of the richest persons and emergence of huge army of jobless persons have reached the extremes. 
					
					 The concentration of capital and wealth into a tiny handful of forces in capitalist countries is the main cause of the economic catastrophe. 
					
					 Governments and capitalists in capitalist countries at present have neither way nor plan to reduce the widening gap between the rich and the poor. 
					
					 Some capitalist countries are reportedly working hard to shore up the economy and tide over the crisis of unemployment, but there can never be a fundamental solution without reform of system. 
					
					 With any desperate efforts, capitalism can never escape from the present crisis. 
					
					 The wider the gap between the rich and the poor becomes, the fiercer the struggle of working masses against it will grow. Finally, capitalism will go to ruin by the struggle.

articles.title: Japan's Sinister Intention to Usurp Name of UN Disclosed
articles.content:
Japan's Sinister Intention to Usurp Name of UN Disclosed 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Japan has recently started examination into a bill on amending the "Law on Cooperation for UN Peace-keeping Activities". The essence of it is to lower the standard of use of weapons by the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" participating in the UN peace-keeping operations.
					
					 Lurking behind this move is a sinister intention of the Japanese reactionaries, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined commentary, adding:
					
					 The present Constitution of Japan banning war disallows the SDF to use weapons in international peace-keeping activities.
					
					 This is not the first time for Japan to amend the said law.
					
					 Towards the beginning of the new century, Japan revised the law to allow the SDF's participation in any overseas military operation.
					
					 Since then the SDF has openly taken part in military activities overseas without restrictions, which confined the SDF's activities to such non-combat duties as relief of refugees, medical service and supply service. Anyhow, the SDF is still prohibited from carrying or using heavy weapons. The current amendment is aimed to remove this hindrance.
					
					 The Japanese militarists' scheme for overseas aggression has entered a practical phase.
					
					 It is the strategic intention of the Japanese reactionaries to realize their old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" with mobilization of the SDF. 
					
					 No matter how desperately Japan tries to wear the helmet of the UN peace-keeping force, it can never cover up its true colors as an aggressor getting heated with ambition for overseas military expansion.

articles.title: Newspapers on Illegality of "Ulsa Five-Point Treaty"
articles.content:
Newspapers on Illegality of "Ulsa Five-Point Treaty"
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The "Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty", fabricated by the Japanese imperialists 106 years ago, was an illegal and invalid treaty in gross violation of the requirements and principles of international law, say leading newspapers of the DPRK today.
					
					 Referring to the details about the "treaty" the Japanese imperialists fabricated by threatening the king, the supreme representative of the Ri Dynasty feudal government, and its ministers, the papers say in bylined articles that it was a dead document as it failed to go through formalities for a treaty.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun says:
					
					 The "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" was a false document the Japanese imperialists faked up at the point of the bayonet and, needless to say, it was an illegal "treaty" with no legal validity.
					
					 Human history does not know such a group of aggressors as the Japanese imperialists that fabricated and proclaimed an international treaty by means of coercion and fraudulence and enforced their fascist colonial rule over other country.
					
					 Well aware of the will of the Korean army and people to get a very high price for it, Japan should honestly admit and apology for all the crimes committed against the Korean people in the past, including the fabrication of the "Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty", and settle the past at an early date.
					
					 Minju Joson condemns the Japanese reactionaries for getting hell-bent on the reinvasion moves in a foolish design to realize the old dream of "Greater east Asia co-prosperity sphere" far from honestly reflecting and making apology and reparation for Japan's past crimes.

articles.title: Prosecution's Action against Progressives Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Prosecution's Action against Progressives Censured in S. Korea
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea made public a statement on Nov. 14 protesting the prosecution's reckless action against its members.
					
					 The prosecution indicted four members of the organization including its co-chairpersons and secretary-general on the charge of violation of the "National Security Law" on Nov. 10, the statement noted, adding: In May the prosecution demanded warrants of arrest for them only to be rejected. This time it reapplied the arrest warrants, finally detaining two of them.
					
					 Hitting at such action to repress the forces aspiring justice and reunification by dint of the fascist law, the statement warned that the "government" and the prosecution would surely face a stern punishment of the people if they persist in crackdown.

articles.title: Settlement of Comfort Women Issue Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Settlement of Comfort Women Issue Urged in S. Korea
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Members of the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps in south Korea staged a demonstration outside Chongwadae on Nov. 14 and 15 to urge the authorities to actively come out for the settlement of the issue of the comfort women for the imperial Japanese army.
					
					 They charged that the authorities are still turning away their face from the matter of getting apology and compensation from the Japanese government for Japan's past sexual slavery crimes.

articles.title: S. Korean Prosecution's Suppression Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Prosecution's Suppression Assailed
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Won Jin Uk, secretary-general the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), on Nov. 12 made clear the stand against the prosecution's suppression of those concerned of the organization.
					
					 The prosecution demanded heavy penalties for Chairman Ri Kyu Jae and former Secretary General Ri Kyong Won of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon and Choe Un A, former chairperson for the headquarters publicity committee, on charges of violation of the "National Security Law", he said, adding: They are pro-reunification patriots who have striven for reconciliation and cooperation between the south and the north of Korea and its peaceful reunification.
					
					 Recalling this fact, Won branded it as a challenge to the desire of all Koreans for reunification and a politically-motivated crackdown upon the movement for independent reunification.
					
					 The recent punishment demanded by the present regime can never be accepted as it termed legitimate patriotic activities for reunification "illegal" and "enemy-benefiting", he stated.
					
					 The South Headquarters of Pomminryon is a public and legitimate reunification movement organization working to build a pan-national reunified state by the Korean nation itself on the three principles for national reunification--independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity--laid down in the July 4 South-North Joint Statement and in the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration, he stressed, declaring:
					
					 It will continue to struggle to bring earlier the new era of independent reunification, peace and prosperity by united efforts of all Koreans in the south and the north and overseas despite any suppression by the authorities.

articles.title: Magazine "Korean Friends-2011" Published in Finland
articles.content:
Magazine "Korean Friends-2011" Published in Finland 

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The Finland-Korea Society published the 2nd issue of its magazine "Korean Friends-2011".
					
					 The magazine carried a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In an article titled "HE Kim Jong Il's External Activities" the magazine noted that he visited the Siberian and Far Eastern regions of the Russian Federation in August and had talks with President Medvedev. It warmly congratulated Kim Jong Il on the successes made during his visit to Russia.
					
					 In an article titled "Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung" it noted that the Korean people are waging a dynamic drive to significantly commemorate the centenary of birth of the President. It went on to say:
					
					 The signal progress made in the DPRK is a shining fruition of the wise leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Extending firm solidarity to the fraternal Korean people, we are firmly convinced that they would win a brilliant victory in building a thriving socialist nation under his leadership.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet by British Organization
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on Nov. 11 posted on its Internet homepage the full text of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is What Keeps Our People Alive".
					
					 The work, published on Nov. 14, Juche 81 (1992), clarifies the necessity to defend the world socialist movement and the socialist cause at present and indicates the tasks and ways for advancing the socialist cause.

articles.title: Japanese Opposition Criticizes PM over TPP Negotiations
articles.content:
Japanese Opposition Criticizes PM over TPP Negotiations
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Japanese opposition parties criticized Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda's remark that he would attend negotiations for the conclusion of the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP).
					
					 The vice-president of the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) in a news conference on November 11 said the prime minister should decide on his participation after making more explanations and deliberations and winning public understanding and support. In case he does not withdraw his remark, the LDP will present a no-confidence motion against the cabinet or censure against the prime minister to Diet, he warned.
					
					 On the same day, the representative of the Komeito Party said the prime minister could not flee from the blame for taking an irresponsible attitude.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Valuing Young Servicepersons
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Valuing Young Servicepersons
						

					 Beijing, November 16 (KCNA) -- Xu Caihou, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, stressed the importance of youth affairs in the army.
					
					 Speaking at a meeting with young servicepersons on Friday, Xu said youth affairs are a very important work vital in the ideological and political work.
					
					 He also called for valuing young servicepersons and properly carrying on the work with them, out of the view that youth affairs are related to the future of the country.

articles.title: China Rejects West's Accusation over Trade with Africa
articles.content:
China Rejects West's Accusation over Trade with Africa

					 Beijing, November 16 (KCNA) -- China rejected the West's accusation that China has been plundering African nations of their resources.
					
					 Speaking at a recent news conference, Liu Guijin, the Chinese government's special representative for African affairs, who attended the 2nd round-table meeting for China-Africa cooperation, said China has mainly imported minerals and energy resources from African nations because the trade structure between China and those nations has long remained irrational.
					
					 Such structure also exists between Africa and the United States, Japan, Britain and France, he noted, adding, “Therefore, their accusation is contrary to facts and unfair as well.”

articles.title: Russian Foreign Minister Demands U.S. Clear Guarantee
articles.content:
Russian Foreign Minister Demands U.S. Clear Guarantee
						

					 Moscow, November 16 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Nov. 14 demanded the U.S. clear guarantee as regards the issue of deploying the missile defense system. 
					
					 The U.S. is not ruling out that combat warships equipped with interceptor missile system can be deployed in the Black Sea, Barents Sea and Baltic Sea as well as the Mediterranean Sea, he said.
					
					 The U.S. unilateral plan for building the global MD system is in force, he noted, adding: The U.S. is expanding MD system even to the Arctic under the pretext of coping with any missile development of Iran.
					
					 The U.S. is telling that Russia should not care about it as it is not aimed at Russia but it cannot satisfy with this, he said, stressing: The guarantee should be clear and written.

articles.title: Russia Exposes U.S. and West's Sinister Intention
articles.content:
Russia Exposes U.S. and West's Sinister Intention
						

					 Moscow, November 16 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the International Affairs Committee of the State Duma of Russia in a recent interview with a news agency exposed the sinister intention of the U.S. and West against Iran. 
					
					 The U.S. and West are accusing Iran of developing nuclear weapons, he said, noting that this is part of the strategy to change Iran's regime by force or create disorder there.
					
					 Iran's nuclear issue can be settled through dialogue and negotiations, he said, warning: Military operation against Iran will bring unexpected consequences and give big losses to those countries participating in it.

articles.title: Iranian President Condemns U.S. and Western's Moves for Domination
articles.content:
Iranian President Condemns U.S. and Western's Moves for Domination

					 Tehran, November 16 (KCNA) -- President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in a diplomatic appearance on Nov. 13 strongly condemned the United States and Western for their moves for domination.
					
					 Now the occupying powers have come to repeat their dominating role in the world, he added.
					
					 He said that the U.S. and its allies want to both save the Zionist regime.
					
					 The spirit of cooperation is needed at the present more than any time before, he noted. 
					
					 He called upon the regional countries to get united to shatter the dominating moves of the arrogant powers.

articles.title: Fidel Castro Warns against Danger of Attack on Iran
articles.content:
Fidel Castro Warns against Danger of Attack on Iran
						

					 Havana, November 16 (KCNA) -- Fidel Castro, leader of the Cuban revolution, in an article on Nov. 14 warned against the danger of military attack of the U.S. and Israel on Iran.
					
					 The attack will inevitably lead to a bloody war, no doubt, the article said.
					
					 Judging from the combat power of Iran, etc., the attack on it differs from military adventures made by Israel against other countries before, it noted.
					
					 The U.S. government intends to overthrow the leadership of Iran under the pretext of arresting it from manufacturing nuclear weapons, it stressed.

articles.title: PNA Accuses Israel of Its Discrimination Moves
articles.content:
PNA Accuses Israel of Its Discrimination Moves

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- A high-ranking official of the Palestinian National Authority in a press conference on Nov. 14 scathingly accused the Israeli authorities of imposing high financial taxes on the Palestinian residents living in eastern Kuds, saying that Israel aims at hardening their daily life and emptying the city of any Arab presence.
					
					 The taxes imposed on the Palestinian residents are four times more than those collected from the Jewish residents, he said, strongly demanding the Israeli authorities cancel such discrimination step at once.

articles.title: Negotiations Only Way to Resolve Iran's Nuclear Issue: Swedish FM
articles.content:
Negotiations Only Way to Resolve Iran's Nuclear Issue: Swedish FM
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Swedish Foreign Minister Carl Bildt stressed a negotiated settlement was the only way to resolve dispute over Iran's nuclear program, daily Die Welt reported Monday.
					
					 He lambasted military threats against Iran, branding them "highly counterproductive."

articles.title: German Ruling Party Adopts New Euro Policy
articles.content:
German Ruling Party Adopts New Euro Policy

					Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The German ruling party adopted a policy of allowing the country's voluntary abandonment of the euro use at its congress on Monday.
					
					 The policy allows the country to give up the use of euro any time, while maintaining the status of EU member nation.
					
					 The adoption of the policy may touch off discussions of the reestablishment of the eurozone order, media reports said.

articles.title: Eurozone Industrial Production Down by 2.0 Percent in September
articles.content:
Eurozone Industrial Production Down by 2.0 Percent in September
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The seasonally adjusted industrial production of eurozone countries experienced a 2.0-percent fall in September compared with the previous month, the European Union (EU)'s statistics Eurostat office said on Monday.

articles.title: European Countries Faced with Worst Financial Crisis
articles.content:
European Countries Faced with Worst Financial Crisis 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- German Chancellor Merkel, addressing a meeting on Nov. 14, expressed concern over the serious financial crisis sweeping Europe.
					
					 The financial crisis facing eurozone countries at present is the largest one since World War II, she said.
					
					 In case this is not settled, the EU will break, she noted.

articles.title: Kenya Sees Local Criminal Networks Driving Counterfeit Crime
articles.content:
Kenya Sees Local Criminal Networks Driving Counterfeit Crime

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Kenya is working hard to combat illegal acts.
					
					 The government set up an organ specializing in the work to prevent production and sell of counterfeit food and strengthened the legal punishment on counterfeit acts by instituting and enforcing relevant laws.
					
					 It also plans to conduct massive information services among residents.

articles.title: Development of Education Science Urged in China
articles.content:
Development of Education Science Urged in China
						

					 Beijing, November 16 (KCNA) -- Chinese State Councilor Liu Yandong called for promoting the development of education science. 
					
					 Addressing the inaugural ceremony of the Institute of Education Science held recently, Liu stressed the need to deeply study and implement the spirit of the 6th Plenum of the 17th C.C., the Communist Party and enhance the role of education science institutions. 
					
					 In this way a system of socialist educational theory with Chinese characteristics should be established and the educational work developed in a scientific way, she added.

articles.title: Gale Hits Arkhangelsk of Russia
articles.content:
Gale Hits Arkhangelsk of Russia 

					 Moscow, November 16 (KCNA) -- A gale hit Arkhangelsk of Russia recently causing damage. 
					
					 As of Nov. 15 power cables were cut off which stopped electricity supply for about 1,500 inhabitants and brought damage to water transportation. 
					
					 Emergency steps are taken to eradicate the aftermath.

articles.title: Economic Depression in Japan
articles.content:
Economic Depression in Japan
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Dai-ichi Life Insurance Co. said Monday its group net profit in the April to September period plunged 58.0 percent from a year earlier.
					
					 Mizuho Financial Group Inc. said Monday it logged a group net profit of 254.67 billion yen in the first half of fiscal 2011, down 25.4 percent from a year earlier.
					
					 Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group Inc. said Monday it logged a 24.8 percent fall from a year earlier in group net profit.
					
					 Japan's core machinery orders fell a seasonally-adjusted 8.2 percent in September from the previous month. The management of machine building businesses is getting serious due to the fall of orders.

articles.title: Protest in Spain
articles.content:
Protest in Spain

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- A massive protest was held in Madrid, Spain on Nov. 13 to oppose the wrong education policy of the authorities.
					
					 Attending there were thousands of people from all walks of life.
					
					 Marching to the streets, the protesters rejected the decision of the authorities on cutting down the budget of educational sector under the pretext of tide over the economic crisis.

articles.title: Anti-Drug Trafficking Operation in Brazil
articles.content:
Anti-Drug Trafficking Operation in Brazil
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- A large-scale anti-drug trafficking operation was carried out in the largest shantytown Rocinha in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil recently. 
					
					In the course of the operation drug trafficking group was detected and eradicated and a large amount of drugs and weapons were confiscated from the criminals. This was made by the government on Nov. 14.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries
						

					 Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Senior Chinese and Ukrainian press administrators agreed Monday to advance press cooperation between their two countries.
					
					 Pakistan and Turkmenistan on Monday signed a bilateral agreement over the price of gas through the planned Turkmenistan-Afghanistan-Pakistan-India (TAPI) gas pipeline.

articles.title: Premier recorre feria de mercancias en Tienda Subterranea de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Premier recorre feria de mercancias en Tienda Subterranea de Pyongyang
						

					Pyongyang, 17 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim recorrio la vispera la feria otonal de mercancias en la Tienda Subterranea de Pyongyang.
					
					En el lugar Choe averiguo en detalles la variedad y calidad de mercancias, la fijacion de precio y el estado de embalaje de articulos.
					
					Gracias al gran proposito del partido de producir un cambio decisivo en la mejora de la vida del pueblo quedaron acondicionados mas excelentemente en todas las localidades del pais las bases de produccion de articulos de la industria ligera, dijo y anadio que por tanto, es importante producir y suministrar mas articulos de consumo popular para que el pueblo se beneficie practicamente de ella.

articles.title: Gran auge de Hamnam en epoca historica
articles.content:
Gran auge de Hamnam en epoca historica

					Pyongyang, 17 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El gran auge de Hamnam (provincia de Hamgyong del Sur de Corea) se extiende por todo el pais reflejando el estilo de lucha revolucionaria, el coraje creativo y el temperamento de decisivo ataque de los habitantes de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur quienes no conocen lo  imposible.
					
					Tal fervor iniciado en la historica epoca, que debe hacer balance de la historia del centenario de Corea de Kim Il Sung y abrir nueva era dorada de prosperidad, tiene su origen en la sabia direccion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Al visitar varias veces la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur el Dirigente enseno el rumbo y los medios a seguir por la provincia y dio la conviccion y animo evaluando altamente los exitos logrados por la provincia aunque sean minimos.
					
					Gracias a la afeccion y la confianza del Dirigente, los obreros del Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong y el Complejo de Vinalon 8 de Febrero produjeron durante unos meses los modernos equipos geotermicos y terminaron el proceso de produccion de vinalon por el hilado horizontal.
					
					Los de la Mina Heroina Juventud de Taehung, la Mina de Ryongyang y la zona de Tanchon demostraron con sus exitos sorprendentes el impetu de ataque de los habitantes de Hamnam.
					
					Los del Complejo de Abonos de Hungnam cumplieron en 2 anos y medio la construccion de proceso de la primera serie en la gasificacion para la produccion de amoniaco segun la gasificacion de lignito despues de eliminar por completo los existentes procesos de produccion.
					
					En ese decurso, los obreros de Hamnam crearon la nueva velocidad de Chollima, velocidad de Corea en la obra de construccion, la produccion y el montaje de los equipos pedidos.
					
					El pueblo coreano traera el cambio trascendental en la construccion de la patria prospera y el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo librando la ofensiva con el espiritu, el coraje y la fuerza creadora de Hamnam.

articles.title: Surin Pitsuwan se refiere a desarrollo de relaciones con Corea
articles.content:
Surin Pitsuwan se refiere a desarrollo de relaciones con Corea
						

					Pyongyang, 17 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Ri Jong Ryul presento el dia 11 ante el secretario general de la Asociacion de Naciones del Sudeste Asiatico (ASEAN), Surin Pitsuwan, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					En la ocasion el secretario general senalo que se regocija de que bajo la sabia direccion de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il todo en la RPDC marchara bien y le deseo mayores exitos y progreso.
					
					Despues del ingreso de la RPDC en el foro regional de ASEAN, las relaciones bilaterales se desarrollan favorablemente, indico.
					
					Deseo que la RPDC contribuyera al desarrollo de las relaciones con ASEAN y al proceso de fundacion de la comunidad de ASEAN aprovechando activamente la escena de esta  organizacion incluyendo el foro regional.

articles.title: Se aviva cada dia mas el turismo a Corea
articles.content:
Se aviva cada dia mas el turismo a Corea
						

					Pyongyang, 17 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Despues de que la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea tomo las medidas para desarrollar el turismo, se aviva cada dia mas el turismo de los huespedes extranjeros a los pintorescos lugares del pais.
					
					Una vez proclamado este ano el decreto sobre el establecimiento de la zona especial del turismo internacional al monte Kumgang y aprobada la ley para el particular, desde junio hasta noviembre, numerosos extranjeros visitaron el monte Kumgang.
					
					La delegacion del partido y el gobierno de la provincia de Liaoning de China, el grupo de turistas chinos por la aerolinea internacional Pyongyang-Xi'an y los miembros de mando de la flotilla de las fuerzas navales del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China recorrieron dicho monte.
					
					Hubo el turismo internacional piloto Rason-monte Kumgang por via maritima.
					
					Los periodistas de China, Rusia, Francia, Estados Unidos y otros paises lo acompanaron para hacer cobertura sobre el turismo piloto.
					
					Los integrantes del grupo partieron de la ciudad Rason y llegaron al destino viajando en el barco Mangyongbong el Mar Este de Corea.
					
					Quedo organizado el turismo internacional experimental por avion charter Harbin-monte Kumgang.
					
					Los turistas dieron vuelta por la cascada Kuryong, el templo Singye, la laguna Samil y el Kumgang Maritimo.
					
					El grupo de turistas de China participo en la ceremonia inaugural del tren para el turismo al monte Chilbo y llego al destino pasando la estacion de Namyang del distrito de Onsong de la provincia coreana de Hamgyong del Norte. Y viajo los lugares famosos de Chilbo interior, Chilbo exterior y Chilbo maritimo.
					
					El primer grupo de turistas de la zona de Shanghai de China por aerolinea internacional Pyongyang-Shanghai visito Mangyongdae, el Monumento a la Idea Juche, el Arco de Triunfo, el Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, el Metro de Pyongyang, el Monumento a la Amistad y otros lugares.
					
					Los chinos del primer grupo de turistas por la misma via Pyongyang-Harbin visitaron la Exposicion Permanente de Amistad Internacional, el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae, Phanmunjom y otros lugares y presenciaron la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang".
					
					Se eleva el interes internacional sobre los lugares pintorescos y de visita de Corea.
					
					La Agencia de Turismo de Asia-Pacifico en Illinois de Estados Unidos planea organizar en el ano proximo el turismo a los montes Paektu y Kumgang y otros lugares de Corea.
